document.masterDocTitle: Illustrated identification key to the genera of New World Micrelytrini (Hemiptera: Alydidae: Micrelytrinae), with description of two new genera, one new species and new distributional records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Illustrated identification key to the genera of New World Micrelytrini (Hemiptera: Alydidae: Micrelytrinae), with description of two new genera, one new species and new distributional records

bibRefCitation.author: Barber, H. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Barber, H. G. (1906) Hemiptera from southwestern Texas. Museum of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences, Science Bulletin, 1, 255 - 289.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Recognized by having the humeral angles of the pronotum and hind femora without spines and the apex of the scutellum is prolonged into a short, very acute, upturned spine.

General distribution. MEXICO :
Hidalgo (Tasquillo), Jalisco (Chamela and El Tuito), Nuevo Leon (Linares), San Luis Potosi (Tamuin and 8 mi W of Valles), and Tamaulipas ( 8 mi W El Limon).
UNITED STATES :
Florida , Georgia , Louisiana , Mississippi , South Carolina , and Texas ( Barber 1906 ; Brailovsky & Zurbia 1979 ; Froeschner 1980 ; Wheeler & Henry 1984 ).

(male), comb. nov. 13,

bicolor Herrich-Schäffer (female).
